wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Lewis Adey (1 March 1930 – January 1994) was a Scottish professional association football player of the 1950s.  Born in Glasgow, he was a centre forward and began his professional career with Doncaster Rovers and later played for Gillingham and Bradford Park Avenue. He made 68 appearances in The Football League and scored 15 goals.
